intro: Acosta boissieri subsp. prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate Acosta, is a low-growing perennial plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spreading, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
